   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Test example code under ../examples/code.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_examples_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcase, no common_test dependency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          dict/1,
   35:          code/1]).
   36: 
   37: %% rpc calls
   38: -export([install/1,
   39:          start/1,
   40:          traffic/1]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("diameter/include/diameter.hrl").
   43: 
   44: %% ===========================================================================
   45: 
   46: -define(util, diameter_util).
   47: 
   48: %% The order here is significant and causes the server to listen
   49: %% before the clients connect.
   50: -define(NODES, [server, client]).
   51: 
   52: %% @inherits dependencies between example dictionaries. This is needed
   53: %% in order compile them in the right order. Can't compile to erl to
   54: %% find out since @inherits is a beam dependency.
   55: -define(INHERITS, [{rfc4006_cc,  [rfc4005_nas]},
   56:                    {rfc4072_eap, [rfc4005_nas]},
   57:                    {rfc4740_sip, [rfc4590_digest]}]).
   58: 
   59: %% Common dictionaries to inherit from examples.
   60: -define(DICT0, [rfc3588_base, rfc6733_base]).
   61: 
   62: %% Transport protocols over which the example Diameter nodes are run.
   63: -define(PROTS, [sctp || ?util:have_sctp()] ++ [tcp]).
   64: 
   65: -define(L, atom_to_list).
   66: -define(A, list_to_atom).
   67: 
   68: %% ===========================================================================
   69: %% common_test wrapping
   70: 
   71: suite() ->
   72:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 75}}].
   73: 
   74: all() ->
   75:     [dict, code].
   76: 
   77: dict(Config) ->
   78:     run(dict, Config).
   79: 
   80: code(Config) ->
   81:     run(code, Config).
   82: 
   83: %% ===========================================================================
   84: 
   85: %% run/0
   86: 
   87: run() ->
   88:     run(all()).
   89: 
   90: %% run/1
   91: 
   92: run({dict, Dir}) ->
   93:     compile_dicts(Dir);
   94: %% The example code doesn't use the example dictionaries, so a
   95: %% separate testcase.
   96: 
   97: run({code, Dir}) ->
   98:     run_code(Dir);
   99: 
  100: run(List)
  101:   when is_list(List) ->
  102:     Tmp = ?util:mktemp("diameter_examples"),
  103:     try
  104:         run(List, Tmp)
  105:     after
  106:         file:del_dir_r(Tmp)
  107:     end.
  108: 
  109: %% run/2
  110: 
  111: %% Eg. erl -noinput -s diameter_examples_SUITE run code -s init stop ...
  112: run(List, Dir)
  113:   when is_list(List) ->
  114:     ?util:run([{[fun run/1, {F, Dir}], 60000} || F <- List]);
  115: 
  116: run(F, Config) ->
  117:     run([F], proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)).
  118: 
  119: %% ===========================================================================
  120: %% compile_dicts/1
  121: %%
  122: %% Compile example dictionaries in examples/dict.
  123: 
  124: compile_dicts(Dir) ->
  125:     Out = mkdir(Dir, "dict"),
  126:     Dirs = [filename:join(H ++ ["examples", "dict"])
  127:             || H <- [[code:lib_dir(diameter)], [here(), ".."]]],
  128:     [] = [{F,D,RC} || {_,F} <- sort(find_files(Dirs, ".*\\.dia$")),
  129:                       D <- ?DICT0,
  130:                       RC <- [make(F, D, Out)],
  131:                       RC /= ok].
  132: 
  133: sort([{_,_} | _] = Files) ->
  134:     lists:sort(fun({A,_},{B,_}) ->
  135:                        sort([filename:rootname(F) || F <- [A,B]])
  136:                end,
  137:                Files);
  138: 
  139: sort([A,B] = L) ->
  140:     [DA,DB] = [dep([D],[]) || D <- L],
  141:     case {[A] -- DB, [B] -- DA} of
  142:         {[], [_]} ->  %% B depends on A
  143:             true;
  144:         {[_], []} ->  %% A depends on B
  145:             false;
  146:         {[_],[_]} ->  %% or not
  147:             length(DA) < length(DB)
  148:     end.
  149: 
  150: %% Recursively accumulate inherited dictionaries.
  151: dep([D|Rest], Acc) ->
  152:     dep(dep(D), Rest, Acc);
  153: dep([], Acc) ->
  154:     Acc.
  155: 
  156: dep([{Dict, _} | T], Rest, Acc) ->
  157:     dep(T, [Dict | Rest], [Dict | Acc]);
  158: dep([], Rest, Acc) ->
  159:     dep(Rest, Acc).
  160: 
  161: make(Path, Dict0, Out)
  162:   when is_atom(Dict0) ->
  163:     make(Path, atom_to_list(Dict0), Out);
  164: 
  165: make(Path, Dict0, Out) ->
  166:     Dict = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Path)),
  167:     {Mod, Pre} = make_name(Dict),
  168:     {"diameter_gen_base" ++ Suf = Mod0, _} = make_name(Dict0),
  169:     Name = Mod ++ Suf,
  170:     try
  171:         ok = to_erl(Path, [{name, Name},
  172:                            {prefix, Pre},
  173:                            {outdir, Out},
  174:                            {inherits, "common/" ++ Mod0}
  175:                            | [{inherits, D ++ "/" ++ M ++ Suf}
  176:                               || {D,M} <- dep(Dict)]]),
  177:         ok = to_beam(filename:join(Out, Name))
  178:     catch
  179:         throw: {_,_} = E ->
  180:             E
  181:     end.
  182: 
  183: to_erl(File, Opts) ->
  184:     case diameter_make:codec(File, Opts) of
  185:         ok ->
  186:             ok;
  187:         No ->
  188:             throw({make, No})
  189:     end.
  190: 
  191: to_beam(Name) ->
  192:     case compile:file(Name ++ ".erl", [return]) of
  193:         {ok, _, _} ->
  194:             ok;
  195:         No ->
  196:             throw({compile, No})
  197:     end.
  198: 
  199: dep(Dict) ->
  200:     case lists:keyfind(list_to_atom(Dict), 1, ?INHERITS) of
  201:         {_, Is} ->
  202:             lists:map(fun inherits/1, Is);
  203:         false ->
  204:             []
  205:     end.
  206: 
  207: inherits(Dict)
  208:   when is_atom(Dict) ->
  209:     inherits(atom_to_list(Dict));
  210: 
  211: inherits(Dict) ->
  212:     {Name, _} = make_name(Dict),
  213:     {Dict, Name}.
  214: 
  215: make_name(Dict) ->
  216:     {R, [$_|N]} = lists:splitwith(fun(C) -> C /= $_ end, Dict),
  217:     {string:join(["diameter_gen", N, R], "_"), "diameter_" ++ N}.
  218: 
  219: %% ===========================================================================
  220: %% compile_code/1
  221: %%
  222: %% Compile example code under examples/code.
  223: 
  224: compile_code(Tmpdir) ->
  225:     {ok, Pid, Node} = slave(peer:random_name(), here()),
  226:     try
  227:         {ok, _Ebin} = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, install, [Tmpdir])
  228:     after
  229:         peer:stop(Pid)
  230:     end.
  231: 
  232: %% Compile in another node since the code path is modified.
  233: install(Tmpdir) ->
  234:     {Top, Dia, Ebin} = install(here(), Tmpdir),
  235: 
  236:     %% Prepend the created directory just so that code:lib_dir/1 finds
  237:     %% it when compile:file/2 tries to resolve include_lib.
  238:     true = code:add_patha(Ebin),
  239:     Dia = code:lib_dir(diameter),  %% assert
  240: 
  241:     Src = filename:join([Top, "examples", "code"]),
  242:     Files = find_files([Src], ".*\\.erl$"),
  243:     [] = [{F,T} || {_,F} <- Files,
  244:                    T <- [compile:file(F, [warnings_as_errors,
  245:                                           return_errors,
  246:                                           {outdir, Ebin}])],
  247:                    ok /= element(1, T)],
  248:     {ok, Ebin}.
  249: 
  250: %% Copy include files into a temporary directory and adjust the code
  251: %% path in order for example code to be able to include them with
  252: %% include_lib. This is really only required when running in the reop
  253: %% since generated includes, that the example code wants to
  254: %% include_lib, are under src/gen and there's no way to get get the
  255: %% preprocessor to find these otherwise. Generated hrls are only be
  256: %% under include in an installation. ("Installing" them locally is
  257: %% anathema.)
  258: install(Dir, Tmpdir) ->
  259:     Top = top(Dir, code:lib_dir(diameter)),
  260: 
  261:     %% Create a new diameter/include in priv_dir. Copy all includes
  262:     %% there, from below ../include and ../src/gen if they exist (in
  263:     %% the repo).
  264:     Tmp = filename:join([Tmpdir, "diameter"]),
  265:     TmpInc = filename:join([Tmp, "include"]),
  266:     TmpEbin = filename:join([Tmp, "ebin"]),
  267:     [] = [{T,E} || T <- [Tmp, TmpInc, TmpEbin],
  268:                    {error, E} <- [file:make_dir(T)]],
  269: 
  270:     Inc = filename:join([Top, "include"]),
  271:     Gen = filename:join([Top, "src", "gen"]),
  272:     Files = find_files([Inc, Gen], ".*\\.hrl$"),
  273:     [] = [{F,E} || {_,F} <- Files,
  274:                    B <- [filename:basename(F)],
  275:                    D <- [filename:join([TmpInc, B])],
  276:                    {error, E} <- [file:copy(F,D)]],
  277:     {Top, Tmp, TmpEbin}.
  278: 
  279: find_files(Dirs, RE) ->
  280:     lists:foldl(fun(D,A) -> fold_files(D, RE, A) end,
  281:                 orddict:new(),
  282:                 Dirs).
  283: 
  284: fold_files(Dir, RE, Acc) ->
  285:     filelib:fold_files(Dir, RE, false, fun store/2, Acc).
  286: 
  287: store(Path, Dict) ->
  288:     orddict:store(filename:basename(Path), Path, Dict).
  289: 
  290: %% ===========================================================================
  291: 
  292: %% enslave/1
  293: %%
  294: %% Start two nodes: one for the server, one for the client.
  295: 
  296: enslave(Prefix) ->
  297:     [{S,N} || D <- [here()],
  298:               S <- ?NODES,
  299:               M <- [lists:append(["diameter", Prefix, ?L(S)])],
  300:               {ok, _, N} <- [slave(M,D)]].
  301: 
  302: slave(Name, Dir) ->
  303:     Args = ["-pa", Dir, filename:join([Dir, "..", "ebin"])],
  304:     {ok, _Pid, _Node} = ?util:peer(#{name => Name, args => Args}).
  305: 
  306: here() ->
  307:     filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)).
  308: 
  309: top(Dir, LibDir) ->
  310:     File = filename:join([Dir, "depend.sed"]),  %% only in the repo
  311:     case filelib:is_regular(File) of
  312:         true  -> filename:join([Dir, ".."]);
  313:         false -> LibDir
  314:     end.
  315: 
  316: %% start/2
  317: 
  318: start({server, Prot, Ebin}) ->
  319:     true = code:add_patha(Ebin),
  320:     ok = diameter:start(),
  321:     ok = server:start(),
  322:     {ok, Ref} = server:listen({Prot, any, 3868}),
  323:     [_] = ?util:lport(Prot, Ref),
  324:     ok;
  325: 
  326: start({client = Svc, Prot, Ebin}) ->
  327:     true = code:add_patha(Ebin),
  328:     ok = diameter:start(),
  329:     true = diameter:subscribe(Svc),
  330:     ok = client:start(),
  331:     {ok, Ref} = client:connect({Prot, loopback, loopback, 3868}),
  332:     receive
  333:         #diameter_event{info = {up, Ref, _, _, _}} ->
  334:             ok
  335:     after
  336:         2000 ->
  337:             timeout
  338:     end;
  339: 
  340: start([Prot, Ebin | Nodes]) ->
  341:     [] = [RC || {S,N} <- Nodes,
  342:                 RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, start, [{S, Prot, Ebin}])],
  343:                 RC /= ok].
  344: 
  345: %% traffic/1
  346: %%
  347: %% Send successful messages from client to server.
  348: 
  349: traffic(server) ->
  350:     ok;
  351: 
  352: traffic(client) ->
  353:     {_, MRef} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> exit(call(100)) end),
  354:     receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, Reason} -> Reason end;
  355: 
  356: traffic({Prot, Ebin}) ->
  357:     Nodes = enslave(?L(Prot)),
  358:     [] = start([Prot, Ebin | Nodes]),
  359:     [] = [RC || {T,N} <- Nodes,
  360:                 RC <- [rpc:call(N, ?MODULE, traffic, [T])],
  361:                 RC /= ok].
  362: 
  363: %% run_code/1
  364: 
  365: run_code(Dir) ->
  366:     true = is_alive(),  %% need distribution for peer nodes
  367:     {ok, Ebin} = compile_code(mkdir(Dir, "code")),
  368:     ?util:run([[fun traffic/1, {T, Ebin}] || T <- ?PROTS]).
  369: 
  370: %% call/1
  371: 
  372: call(0) ->
  373:     ok;
  374: 
  375: call(N) ->
  376:     {ok, _} = client:call(),
  377:     call(N-1).
  378: 
  379: %% mkdir/2
  380: 
  381: mkdir(Top, Dir) ->
  382:     Tmp = filename:join(Top, Dir),
  383:     ok = file:make_dir(Tmp),
  384:     Tmp.
